p: Excessive levels of stress represented a critical factor that could affect work environment and compromise performance, especially during an emergency ( Müller et al., 2009). Furthermore, chronic work stress among healthcare workers may be associated with job satisfaction, physical health and post traumatic symptoms ( Rice, Glass, Ogle, and Parsian, 2014; Blau, Bentley, and Eggerichs‐Purcell, 2012), also producing long term psychological consequences ( Khalid, Khalid, Qabajah, Barnard, and Qushmaq, 2016). A recent review underlined the importance of satisfying basic needs, taking breaks during working hours, following a healthy diet and doing physical exercise. Besides, keeping personal routine may help to gain feelings of security and control ( Petzold, Plag, and Stroehle, 2020).
